expressivity.contactUtilizationMethod: Grip the can sideways near its lower half with thumb and first two fingers, leaving the opposite end of the cylinder protruding forward as the working tip
expressivity.substrateUtilizationMethod: Leave the keyboard in its normal position and strike the exposed end of the can onto the central block of keycaps, keeping blows short and vertical
expressivity.expectedHapticFeedback: The chisel hits against the rigid stone tablet. Firm steady upward resistance
expressivity.explanation: Key switches depress, absorbing force and introducing springiness; lacks the unwavering hardness of stone and delivers nearly uniform bottom-out feel.

expressivity.physicalContactObject: red Coca-Cola aluminum can
expressivity.contactUtilizationMethod: Grip the can sideways near its lower half with thumb and first two fingers, leaving the opposite end of the cylinder protruding forward as the working tip
expressivity.substrateUtilizationMethod: Set the mouse flat on the desk, curved shell up, and tap the can’s tip onto the highest point of the shell with brief downward strikes
expressivity.expectedHapticFeedback: The chisel hits against the rigid stone tablet. Firm steady upward resistance
expressivity.explanation: Hard plastic shell gives moderate rigidity but the light mouse skates across the desk, reducing perceived resistance and variation.

expressivity.physicalContactObject: red Coca-Cola aluminum can
expressivity.contactUtilizationMethod: Grip the can sideways near its lower half with thumb and first two fingers, leaving the opposite end of the cylinder protruding forward as the working tip
expressivity.substrateUtilizationMethod: Keep the controller resting face-up and strike the right-hand grip’s hard plastic surface with the can’s exposed end
expressivity.expectedHapticFeedback: The chisel hits against the rigid stone tablet. Firm steady upward resistance
expressivity.explanation: Plastic grip is rigid but the controller is light and rounded, so impacts are muted and the object shifts, limiting clear force feedback.

expressivity.physicalContactObject: red Coca-Cola aluminum can

expressivity.explanation: Glass is very rigid and rings, but the light stemmed glass moves easily and user must strike gently to avoid breakage, reducing range of force variation conveyed.

expressivity.physicalContactObject: red Coca-Cola aluminum can

expressivity.physicalContactObject: red Coca-Cola aluminum can

expressivity.physicalContactObject: red Coca-Cola aluminum can

expressivity.physicalContactObject: red Coca-Cola aluminum can

expressivity.physicalContactObject: red Coca-Cola aluminum can

expressivity.physicalContactObject: red Coca-Cola aluminum can

expressivity.expectedHapticFeedback: The chisel hits against the rigid stone tablet. Firm steady upward resistance
expressivity.explanation: Bean bag is fully compliant and dissipates force, providing no sense of rigid upward push expected from stone.

expressivity.physicalContactObject: spray bottle with white nozzle and light blue liquid
expressivity.contactUtilizationMethod: Grip the cylindrical neck just below the trigger with an overhand hold, directing the nozzle outward as the chisel head
expressivity.substrateUtilizationMethod: Stand the can upright on the desk. Bring the spray-bottle nozzle straight to the mid-height of the can’s side and tap or press the metal surface with each downward motion.
expressivity.expectedHapticFeedback: The chisel hits against the rigid stone tablet. Firm steady upward resistance
expressivity.explanation: Thin aluminum wall gives a crisp but slightly springy feel and audible ping. Rigid enough to signal impact yet dents easily and lacks the mass of stone, limiting vibration richness.

expressivity.physicalContactObject: spray bottle with white nozzle and light blue liquid
expressivity.physicalSubstrateObject: black and silver extendable selfie stick
expressivity.contactUtilizationMethod: Grip the cylindrical neck just below the trigger with an overhand hold, directing the nozzle outward as the chisel head
expressivity.substrateUtilizationMethod: Lay the selfie-stick shaft flat on the desk with the metal section exposed. Steady it with the free hand if needed, then drive the nozzle tip downward onto the shaft near its center.
expressivity.expectedHapticFeedback: The chisel hits against the rigid stone tablet. Firm steady upward resistance
expressivity.explanation: Aluminum shaft is long, dense, and well-supported by the desk, giving firm resistance and metallic vibration transmission similar to chisel-on-stone. Slight rolling risk reduces consistency, but variation with strike force is clear.

expressivity.physicalContactObject: spray bottle with white nozzle and light blue liquid
expressivity.contactUtilizationMethod: Grip the cylindrical neck just below the trigger with an overhand hold, directing the nozzle outward as the chisel head
expressivity.substrateUtilizationMethod: Close the clip and place it flat on the desk. Strike the broad top shell with the nozzle tip, keeping the clip from sliding by bracing it lightly with the opposite hand.
expressivity.expectedHapticFeedback: The chisel hits against the rigid stone tablet. Firm steady upward resistance
expressivity.explanation: Hard plastic gives some resistance but flexes and produces dull sound. Limited mass and small contact patch diminish vibration cues; feedback feels generic rather than stone-like.

expressivity.physicalContactObject: spray bottle with white nozzle and light blue liquid
expressivity.physicalSubstrateObject: yellow snack bag of Japanese pea crackers

expressivity.substrateUtilizationMethod: Rest the unopened bag flat on the desk. Tap the nozzle tip onto a firm spot near a corner where the contents are densely packed to meet resistance through the plastic.

expressivity.explanation: Crunchy food inside gives squishy, crinkly sensation—nowhere near the rigid, steady pushback of stone. Impact forces are absorbed, providing little variation besides soft crush sounds.

expressivity.physicalContactObject: spray bottle with white nozzle and light blue liquid
expressivity.contactUtilizationMethod: Grip the cylindrical neck just below the trigger with an overhand hold, directing the nozzle outward as the chisel head

expressivity.explanation: Thick aluminum block, firmly anchored by the monitor’s weight, yields very hard, immovable resistance and transmits sharp vibrations through the plastic nozzle, closely approximating chisel-on-stone expressivity.

expressivity.physicalContactObject: spray bottle with white nozzle and light blue liquid
expressivity.contactUtilizationMethod: Grip the cylindrical neck just below the trigger with an overhand hold, directing the nozzle outward as the chisel head

expressivity.expectedHapticFeedback: The chisel hits against the rigid stone tablet. Firm steady upward resistance
expressivity.explanation: Key switches compress and click, generating inconsistent travel and muffled bottom-outs. Provides some impact variation but lacks the continuous, unyielding resistance characteristic of stone.

expressivity.physicalContactObject: spray bottle with white nozzle and light blue liquid
expressivity.contactUtilizationMethod: Grip the cylindrical neck just below the trigger with an overhand hold, directing the nozzle outward as the chisel head
expressivity.substrateUtilizationMethod: Stabilize the mouse face-up on the desk. Drive the nozzle tip downward onto the rigid curved shell near its center.

expressivity.explanation: Rigid polycarbonate shell supported by desk provides decent hardness and a consistent stop, though slight curvature and hollow interior reduce perceived mass and vibration richness.

expressivity.physicalContactObject: spray bottle with white nozzle and light blue liquid
expressivity.contactUtilizationMethod: Grip the cylindrical neck just below the trigger with an overhand hold, directing the nozzle outward as the chisel head
expressivity.substrateUtilizationMethod: Leave the controller face-up. Aim the nozzle at the hard plastic grip area beside one thumb-stick and tap repeatedly.
expressivity.expectedHapticFeedback: The chisel hits against the rigid stone tablet. Firm steady upward resistance
expressivity.explanation: Hard ABS shell resists well and transmits a clear thud, but internal cavity cushions higher-frequency vibration; contact area is also slightly curved, so feedback is solid but not stone-like dense.

expressivity.physicalContactObject: spray bottle with white nozzle and light blue liquid

expressivity.substrateUtilizationMethod: Keep the glass upright on its base. Tap the outside of the bowl near mid-height with the nozzle, striking lightly to avoid tipping.

expressivity.explanation: Thin glass rings and feels fragile; requires gentle taps that limit force range and therefore expressivity. Hardness is present but not the steady, confident resistance of stone.

expressivity.physicalContactObject: spray bottle with white nozzle and light blue liquid

expressivity.physicalContactObject: spray bottle with white nozzle and light blue liquid

expressivity.physicalContactObject: spray bottle with white nozzle and light blue liquid

expressivity.physicalContactObject: spray bottle with white nozzle and light blue liquid

expressivity.substrateUtilizationMethod: Set the brush bristles-down so the flat wooden back faces up. Tap the center of that wooden back with the nozzle tip.

expressivity.explanation: Wood back is hard but lighter and slightly resonant, giving a hollow knock rather than dense stone feel. Still provides consistent resistance for basic impact variation.

expressivity.physicalContactObject: spray bottle with white nozzle and light blue liquid
expressivity.contactUtilizationMethod: Grip the cylindrical neck just below the trigger with an overhand hold, directing the nozzle outward as the chisel head
expressivity.substrateUtilizationMethod: Place the sponge scrub-side up on the table. Press the nozzle downward onto the green abrasive surface near one corner.

expressivity.physicalContactObject: spray bottle with white nozzle and light blue liquid

expressivity.physicalContactObject: spray bottle with white nozzle and light blue liquid

expressivity.physicalContactObject: spray bottle with white nozzle and light blue liquid

expressivity.physicalContactObject: spray bottle with white nozzle and light blue liquid

expressivity.physicalContactObject: spray bottle with white nozzle and light blue liquid

realism.physicalContactObject: metallic ballpoint pen with a clear barrel
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Hold the pen in a standard tripod grip and glide its tip across a surface exactly as you would move a paint brush
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Stand the can upright on the table with its curved side facing you. Glide the pen tip over the smooth aluminum side while slowly rotating the can with your free hand to extend the stroke area.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: Oil paint on a large size canvas with a paint brush. With gentle pressure, the resistance increases smoothly with a subtle pushback sensation
realism.explanation: The aluminum can is a rigid, slick surface offering almost no yielding resistance; the hard pen tip merely skates over it, lacking the progressive push-back and slight texture of oil paint on canvas.

realism.physicalContactObject: metallic ballpoint pen with a clear barrel
realism.physicalSubstrateObject: black and silver extendable selfie stick
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Hold the pen in a standard tripod grip and glide its tip across a surface exactly as you would move a paint brush
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Collapse the stick and lay it flat on the desk. Use the cylindrical metal shaft as a narrow drawing lane, sliding the pen length-wise along the tube for controlled strokes.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: Oil paint on a large size canvas with a paint brush. With gentle pressure, the resistance increases smoothly with a subtle pushback sensation
realism.explanation: Narrow metal shaft is extremely hard and curved; no surface give, no canvas-like texture. Interaction feels entirely unlike brush on stretched canvas.

realism.physicalContactObject: metallic ballpoint pen with a clear barrel
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Hold the pen in a standard tripod grip and glide its tip across a surface exactly as you would move a paint brush
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Set the clip on its side so one flat jaw faces up. Move the pen tip back and forth across this flat plastic jaw, using its slight give for pressure variation.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: Oil paint on a large size canvas with a paint brush. With gentle pressure, the resistance increases smoothly with a subtle pushback sensation
realism.explanation: Flat plastic jaw provides only minimal flex before bottoming out; area is tiny. Resistance is binary rather than smoothly progressive.

realism.physicalContactObject: metallic ballpoint pen with a clear barrel
realism.physicalSubstrateObject: yellow snack bag of Japanese pea crackers
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Hold the pen in a standard tripod grip and glide its tip across a surface exactly as you would move a paint brush
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Lay the unopened bag flat on the table and smooth it with your palm. Glide the pen tip over the taut plastic surface, letting the underlying peanuts provide gentle cushioned resistance.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: Oil paint on a large size canvas with a paint brush. With gentle pressure, the resistance increases smoothly with a subtle pushback sensation
realism.explanation: Air-filled bag offers some yielding compliance and subtle pushback, approximating paint thickness. However, the plastic is slippery and uneven lumps create inconsistent feedback unlike stretched canvas.

realism.physicalContactObject: metallic ballpoint pen with a clear barrel
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Hold the pen in a standard tripod grip and glide its tip across a surface exactly as you would move a paint brush
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Face the rear aluminum panel of the iMac and use its broad vertical surface as a ‘canvas.’ Lightly stroke the pen up and down the flat metal back.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: Oil paint on a large size canvas with a paint brush. With gentle pressure, the resistance increases smoothly with a subtle pushback sensation
realism.explanation: Large, upright surface matches canvas orientation, but hard anodized aluminum lacks the micro-give of stretched fabric and the pen tip is far stiffer than bristles; resistance does not build smoothly.

realism.physicalContactObject: metallic ballpoint pen with a clear barrel
realism.physicalSubstrateObject: mechanical keyboard with dark gray keycaps
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Hold the pen in a standard tripod grip and glide its tip across a surface exactly as you would move a paint brush
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Hold the keyboard upright with keys facing you. Glide the pen horizontally across the tops of several keycaps, allowing subtle key depression to provide progressive resistance.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: Oil paint on a large size canvas with a paint brush. With gentle pressure, the resistance increases smoothly with a subtle pushback sensation
realism.explanation: Keycaps depress smoothly with finger-level force, giving a noticeable but gentle pushback that loosely mimics canvas tension. Discrete key edges introduce bumps, yet the progressive travel creates some convincing resistance.

realism.physicalContactObject: metallic ballpoint pen with a clear barrel
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Hold the pen in a standard tripod grip and glide its tip across a surface exactly as you would move a paint brush
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Place the mouse upside-down so the smooth curved top is exposed. Stroke the pen along this glossy arc for controlled glide and gentle contour shifts.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: Oil paint on a large size canvas with a paint brush. With gentle pressure, the resistance increases smoothly with a subtle pushback sensation
realism.explanation: Surface is rigid plastic with minimal drag; curvature breaks illusion of flat canvas and no progressive give is present.

realism.physicalContactObject: metallic ballpoint pen with a clear barrel
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Hold the pen in a standard tripod grip and glide its tip across a surface exactly as you would move a paint brush
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Grip the controller sideways so its broad plastic underside faces you. Move the pen across this matte plastic belly, riding over the gentle curves.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: Oil paint on a large size canvas with a paint brush. With gentle pressure, the resistance increases smoothly with a subtle pushback sensation
realism.explanation: Matte plastic offers minor friction but zero yield. Small, curved area and hard surface diverge strongly from canvas feel.

realism.physicalContactObject: metallic ballpoint pen with a clear barrel
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Hold the pen in a standard tripod grip and glide its tip across a surface exactly as you would move a paint brush
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Lay the glass on its side and brace it with your free hand. Glide the pen along the smooth bowl, rolling the glass slightly to extend strokes.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: Oil paint on a large size canvas with a paint brush. With gentle pressure, the resistance increases smoothly with a subtle pushback sensation
realism.explanation: Glass is slick and inflexible; curved surface and risk of slipping undermine resemblance to flat, resistant canvas.

realism.physicalContactObject: metallic ballpoint pen with a clear barrel
realism.physicalSubstrateObject: small succulent plant in yellow ceramic pot
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Hold the pen in a standard tripod grip and glide its tip across a surface exactly as you would move a paint brush
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Hold the pot tilted so the glazed ceramic side faces up. Glide the pen over the glossy pot wall, rotating the pot slowly for longer strokes.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: Oil paint on a large size canvas with a paint brush. With gentle pressure, the resistance increases smoothly with a subtle pushback sensation

realism.physicalContactObject: metallic ballpoint pen with a clear barrel
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Hold the pen in a standard tripod grip and glide its tip across a surface exactly as you would move a paint brush
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Stand beside the chair and use the broad mesh backrest as the drawing area, sweeping the pen across the slightly springy mesh for smooth resistance.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: Oil paint on a large size canvas with a paint brush. With gentle pressure, the resistance increases smoothly with a subtle pushback sensation
realism.explanation: Tensioned mesh gives slightly under pressure, offering a canvas-like rebound over a large flat area. Texture is coarser than canvas, and pen tip still lacks bristle softness, but overall resistance profile is fairly convincing.

realism.physicalContactObject: metallic ballpoint pen with a clear barrel
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Hold the pen in a standard tripod grip and glide its tip across a surface exactly as you would move a paint brush
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Hold the bottle horizontally and draw the pen along the cylindrical side, adjusting grip to roll the bottle for extended vertical strokes.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: Oil paint on a large size canvas with a paint brush. With gentle pressure, the resistance increases smoothly with a subtle pushback sensation
realism.explanation: Cylindrical plastic wall is hard and curved; negligible give. Rolling motion distracts from expected steady canvas resistance.

realism.physicalContactObject: metallic ballpoint pen with a clear barrel
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Hold the pen in a standard tripod grip and glide its tip across a surface exactly as you would move a paint brush
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Place the brush flat with bristles facing up. Sweep the pen lightly across the bristle tips, using their springy give for progressive pushback.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: Oil paint on a large size canvas with a paint brush. With gentle pressure, the resistance increases smoothly with a subtle pushback sensation
realism.explanation: Bristles supply springy compliance resembling paint-loaded brush meeting canvas, but individual strands create scratchy, uneven texture and depth, unlike a flat canvas plane.

realism.physicalContactObject: metallic ballpoint pen with a clear barrel
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Hold the pen in a standard tripod grip and glide its tip across a surface exactly as you would move a paint brush
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Lay the sponge green side up. Glide the pen over the textured green surface, pressing slightly to feel graduated resistance from the foam beneath.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: Oil paint on a large size canvas with a paint brush. With gentle pressure, the resistance increases smoothly with a subtle pushback sensation
realism.explanation: Textured abrasive layer plus compressible foam beneath yields smoothly with increasing pressure, imitating the growing resistance of canvas soaked with viscous paint. Size is small but haptic profile is convincing.

realism.explanation: Small, hard, polished steel plane with zero compliance; interaction feels like writing on glass, not painting on canvas.

realism.explanation: Steel blade is hard and produces crisp metallic clicks, yet the small tool may slide and lacks the broad, immovable surface of a stone tablet.

realism.physicalContactObject: spray bottle with white nozzle and light blue liquid
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Grip the cylindrical neck just below the trigger with an overhand hold, directing the nozzle outward as the chisel head
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Stand the weight upright. Bring the nozzle straight down onto the flat top face and deliver controlled taps.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: The chisel hits against the rigid stone tablet. Firm steady upward resistance
realism.explanation: Dense steel mass gives very firm, unmoving resistance and a sharp vibration similar to stone; only limitation is small contact patch compared to a broad tablet.

realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Leave the plush bed in place. Press the nozzle gently into the green top near the rim where stuffing is denser.

realism.explanation: Soft stuffing absorbs force completely, giving no solid rebound; feels nothing like chisel-on-stone interaction.

realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Keep the umbrella leaning vertically against the bench. Tap the rigid plastic shaft near mid-length with the nozzle tip.

realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Stand beside the bench. Drive the nozzle tip downward onto the exposed black metal armrest.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: The chisel hits against the rigid stone tablet. Firm steady upward resistance
realism.explanation: Armrest metal is solidly affixed to heavy furniture, giving good mass and crisp rebound. Slight curve and coating reduce stone-like texture, but resistance feels convincingly rigid.
